chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott R Gehner was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Scott R Gehner was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision on Count 3.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but
IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 113 days.
Consecutive to: to any sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

DNA Surcharge, Blood Draw Fee and Transcript fee to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Once Blood fee is paid it will be forwarded to the City of New Berlin Police Dept.
Transcript fee will be paid to the DA's Office.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol. 
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns or liquor stores)
Attendance to the Victim Impact Panel during the period of Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott R Gehner in court, in custody, with attorney Justin L. Singleton.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing. Court imposed the following sentence:

 COUNT 3

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

2 1/2/ YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 113 days)
  -  12 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 
SENTENCE TO RUN CONSECUTIVE TO ANY CURRENT SENTENCE

*D/L REVOCATION: 24 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 24 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $40 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to City of New Berlin Police Department);
TRANSCRIPT FEE: $8 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be paid to the District Attorney's Office)
FINE:  $1443.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);
DNA SURCHARGE: $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);


Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


AS TO COUNT  #2

FINE $568.00  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision on ct. 3)
DNA SURCHARGE IS WAIVED

records.addlTxt: Note from jurors
jurors selection and peremptory challegnes
Random listing report - voir dire
stipulation and order for return/destruction of exhibits

Defendant Scott R Gehner in court, in custody, with attorney Justin L. Singleton.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for 12 person jury trial. Defense makes arguments on his Motion. State presents arguments. Court denied the Motion. Jurors enter the courtroom @ 9:25 am. Oath to jurors on voir dire. Court conducts voir dire. State conducts voir dire. Defense requests sidebar.  Defense conducts voir dire. Jurors are selected @ 10:28 am. State presents opening arguments. Defense presents opening arguments. Court takes break and reconved @ 10:55 am. Officer Steve Dodson from the City of New Berlin PD was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. State presents exhibits 1 and 2, mark and received. Cross examination by the defense. Defense presents exhibits 11, marked and received. Exhibit 12, marked. Redirect by the state. Redirect by the defense. Court excused the jurors for lunch 12:05 pm. Defense objects to the blood specimen. State has not present that evidence, court denied the motion. Court reconved @ 1:07 pm. Jennifer Greene was sworn and testified by behalf of the State. State presents exhibt #3, marked and received, exhibit #5, marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. Defense presents exhibits 8, 9, and 10, marked and received. Exhibit 7, marked and 6 marked, 13 marked. State rests. Court takes recess @ 2:27 pm. Court reconved @2:38 pm.  Defense moves to dismiss and presents arguments. Court denied. Dr. Jimmie Valentine, by spyke, was sworn and testified by behalf of the defense. Cross examination by the state. Redirect by the defense. Defense rests. Court takes recess @ 3:30 pm. Court reconved @ 3:40 pm. Parties address jury instructions. Jurors enter courtroom @ 3:54 pm. Court reads jury instructions. State presents closing arguments. Defense presents closing arguments. Clerk swears in baliff and jurors leave to deliberate @ 4:33 pm. 
Jurors have question. Case recalled @ 5:17 pm. Court responds back on their note. 
Jurors have reached a verdict @ 5:25 pm. 
Jurors entered the courtroom @ 5:36 pm.  Court reads the verdict.
Jurors find the defendant guilty on both counts. Jurors are excused 5:43
Defense counsel is requesting that the court find the defendant not guilty. Court denied.
State moves for judgment on the PAC and dismiss the OAWI. Court grants. 


  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Order denying defendant's Motion to Exclude State's Expert.  Order granting State's Motion to Exclude Defense Expert 1, 2 and 3.  4 and 5 is granted in part and denied in part.

Defendant Scott R Gehner in court, in custody, with attorney Justin L. Singleton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense presents statements about Mr. Valentines appearance for the next court date. State does not object to Dr. Valentines appearance to be remotely for the trial. Court provides oral ruling from the Motion hearing that was heard on 07/25 regarding the Daubert hearing. Defendant's Motion to Exclude the State's Expert is denied. As to the State's Motion to Exclude Defendant's Expert, item 1 is granted, 2 is granted, 3 is granted, 4 is denied and 5 is granted in part and denied in part. Parties address Motion in Limine that was heard prior to this date, 5 were granted for the state and 6 were granted to the defense. Trial remains as scheduled.

State presents closing arguments. Defense presents closing arguments. Court to provide decision on this motion at the jury status hearing and address the next motion.
